com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.util

Enum HtmlClassProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<HtmlClassProperties>
      • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.util.HtmlClassProperties
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<HtmlClassProperties>

    public enum HtmlClassProperties
extends Enum<HtmlClassProperties>
    Provides an enum which can be used to add HTML class attribute values to components.

    Included are values representing common icons. By default these will apply icons from the Font Awesome library included with the default theme. Each icon may be individually overridden using a configuration property. Each overrideable icon includes documentation of the configuration parameter used to set the icon's HTML class attribute value. If the default icons are changed your theme must include a way to ensure the new icon is available. This is safest if simply changing to an alternate Font Awesome icon.

    Since:
    1.2.0
    Author:
    Mark Reeves

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • ALIGN_CENTER

        public static final HtmlClassProperties ALIGN_CENTER
        Center align the content of any component.

        Should not be used with WColumn, WList, ListLayout or ColumnLayout as these all have the ability to set alignment intrinsically to the component/layout.

      • ALIGN_LEFT

        public static final HtmlClassProperties ALIGN_LEFT
        Left align the content of any component. This is not terribly useful as this is the default alignment but can be used to re-set alignment if one has used ALIGN_CENTER or ALIGN_CENTER.

        Should not be used with WColumn, WList, ListLayout or ColumnLayout as these all have the ability to set alignment intrinsically to the component/layout.

      • ALIGN_RIGHT

        public static final HtmlClassProperties ALIGN_RIGHT
        Right align the content of any component.

        Should not be used with WColumn, WList, ListLayout or ColumnLayout as these all have the ability to set alignment intrinsically to the component/layout.

      • BORDER

        public static final HtmlClassProperties BORDER
        Apply the theme default border to any component. This will only work if the border is not set by a more specific selector and will not apply padding so the border will sit directly against the content unless the component has default padding.

      • BREAK_WORDS

        public static final HtmlClassProperties BREAK_WORDS
        Allow the text content of this component to break at non-word boundaries. This should be used with extreme caution. If you apply it to a component in a horizontal FlowLayout you could end up with a long column of single letters. Best applied to WStyledText.

      • HORIZONTAL_SCROLL

        public static final HtmlClassProperties HORIZONTAL_SCROLL
        Make a container scroll horizontally if its content does not fit. Probably only really useful for WTable. Using this on any component which contains menus or date fields may have unexpected consequences.

      • OFF_SCREEN

        public static final HtmlClassProperties OFF_SCREEN
        Move a component out of the viewport but leave it available for accessibility purposes. This is most useful for WHeading to set accessibility markers but can be used for other explanatory components. Move a component out of the viewport but leave it available for accessibility purposes. This is most useful for WHeading to set accessibility markers but can be used for other explanatory components.

        For example one could use this with WStyledText with whitespace PARAGRAPHS to add some explanatory information for visually impaired users if one's UI design is dependent on visual context.

      • RESPOND

        public static final HtmlClassProperties RESPOND
        Indicates that this component will opt-in to responsive design options. This is usually relevant to layout components such as WPanel or WRow

      • ICON

        public static final HtmlClassProperties ICON
        Apply an icon to a component. The icon will appear before any other content in the component. If you have other visible content in the component you may prefer to use ICON_BEFORE which will put a small gap between the icon and the following content.

        Must be used in conjunction with another value available to your theme. By default these are from Font Awesome. This is extremely useful for WButton or WLink when the component has no other visible content.

      • ICON_AFTER

        public static final HtmlClassProperties ICON_AFTER
        Apply an icon to the end of a component. The icon will appear after any other content in the component and there will be a small gap between the end of the content and the icon.

        Must be used in conjunction with another value available to your theme. By default these are from Font Awesome. This is extremely useful for WButton or WLink when the component has visible text.

      • ICON_BEFORE

        public static final HtmlClassProperties ICON_BEFORE
        Apply an icon to the beginning of a component. The icon will appear before any other content in the component.and there will be a small gap between the icon and the content.

        Must be used in conjunction with another value available to your theme. By default these are from Font Awesome. This is extremely useful for WButton or WLink when the component has visible text.

      • ICON_HELP

        public static final HtmlClassProperties ICON_HELP
        Apply a "help" icon to a component. Most useful for WButton or WLink

        To change the icon use configuration param "com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.HtmlClass.icon.help".

      • ICON_HELP_AFTER

        public static final HtmlClassProperties ICON_HELP_AFTER
        Apply a "help" icon to the end of a component.

        To change the icon use configuration param "com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.HtmlClass.icon.help".

      • ICON_HELP_BEFORE

        public static final HtmlClassProperties ICON_HELP_BEFORE
        Apply a "help" icon to the beginning of a component.

        To change the icon use configuration param "com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.HtmlClass.icon.help".

      • ICON_INFO

        public static final HtmlClassProperties ICON_INFO
        Apply an "information" icon to a component. Do not use with WMessageBox.

        To change the icon use configuration param "com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.HtmlClass.icon.info".

      • ICON_INFO_AFTER

        public static final HtmlClassProperties ICON_INFO_AFTER
        Apply an "information" icon to the end of a component. Do not use with WMessageBox.

        To change the icon use configuration param "com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.HtmlClass.icon.info".

        To change the icon use configuration param "com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.HtmlClass.icon.info".

      • ICON_ADD

        public static final HtmlClassProperties ICON_ADD
        Add an "add" icon. The default icon is the same as is used in WMultiTextField and WMultiDropdown.

        To change the icon use configuration param "com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.HtmlClass.icon.add".

        for (HtmlClassProperties c : HtmlClassProperties.values())
    System.out.println(c);

        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared
